text: Diane Helen Wood Middlebrook (April 16, 1939 â€“ December 15, 2007)'Obituary of Diane Middlebrook', Stanford University website, accessed 05 September 2011 was an American biographer, poet, and teacher. She taught feminist studies for many years at Stanford University. She was best known for writing biographies of poets Anne Sexton and Sylvia Plath (along with Plath's husband Ted Hughes), and jazz musician Billy Tipton. She was born in Pocatello, Idaho. Middlebrook died in San Francisco, California from liposarcoma, aged 68. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America == References == == Other websites == *DianeMiddlebrook.com, the author's personal web site Category:1939 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Educators from Idaho Category:American poets Category:Cancer deaths in San Francisco Category:Deaths from liposarcoma Category:Writers from Idaho
title: Diane Middlebrook
